title: A City reborn
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Cities and towns - United States
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/City and town life

description: Illustrates good city planning, showing how Fresno, California, has revitalised its city centre by a plan implemented from 1964, diverting traffic from the city core, turning the main street into a long pedestrian mall. Contrasts the success of the plan with the inner city congestion and suburban disorganisation of many cities.
